anomalies.message: [ESCALATE] Contradictory ML outputs (ensemble at 0% risk vs. RF/XGBoost ~71%) and missing written-amount field warrant manual review.

raw_text:
WESTERN WESTERN UNION®
UNION
MONEY ORDER
PAY TO: JANE SMITH
987557821
AMOUNT:
$750.00
DATE: OCTOBER 26, 2023
SEVEN HUNDRED FISTY AND 00//100 DOLLARS
FROM: JOHN DOE
123 OAK ST, ANYTOWN, CA 91234
9875647821
AGENT AUTHORIZED SIGNATURE

ai_analysis.summary: Contradictory ML outputs (ensemble at 0% risk vs. RF/XGBoost ~71%) and missing written-amount field warrant manual review.
reasoning: Ensemble model reports 0% fraud risk with 0% confidence, yet both Random Forest (71.0%) and XGBoost (71.8%) flags are high—this inconsistency reduces automated trust.
Written amount is not provided; training data shows 45% of frauds involve numeric-written mismatches, so absence of a written amount is a red flag.
New customer with no transaction history; no historical behavioral patterns to validate legitimacy.
No ML-identified indicators, but the conflict itself is a strong fraud signal per past cases where model disagreement preceded confirmed fraud.
actionable_recommendations: Ask the purchaser for the written-amount entry and compare it to USD 750.00.
Verify purchaser’s government-issued ID and ensure it matches “JOHN DOE.”
Call Western Union’s fraud hotline to confirm the serial number 9875647821 and issuance details.
ai_analysis.historical_comparison: No directly similar past cases, but model disagreement has been a leading precursor to fraud in other workflows.
